revised_title: Human Factors in Hazardous Situations: Analyzing the Complexity of Accidents and Human Error
tldr: This article discusses the challenges of analyzing accidents and identifying human error in complex, rapidly changing industrial systems. It addresses the nature of causal explanations and the ambiguity of rules used in accident analysis. The author also analyzes the concept of human error and its relation to human adaptation and learning, concluding that the identification of errors as a separate class of behavior is becoming increasingly difficult in modern work environments.
